title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 474.6 - Surrender and cancellation of permits and stickers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 474.6 - Surrender and cancellation of permits and stickers

State Regulations

Tax Law, ยง 502
(a) The permit issued to a carrier for a
motor vehicle must be surrendered for cancellation to the State Tax Commission
and the sticker issued therefor must be destroyed within five days after the
termination of his right to the use or control of the motor vehicle. However, if a permit and sticker are issued to the owner and the vehicle is subsequently
leased, the owner may retain possession of the permit and sticker although they
may not be used on any other motor vehicle. (b) A permit issued to the owner of a motor
vehicle may be surrendered and the sticker destroyed when the motor vehicle is
leased for a period of more than 30 consecutive days under a lease or agreement
granting direct control thereof to the lessee in order to relieve the owner of
the necessity of including that vehicle in his tax returns. Similarly, after a
permit and sticker are issued for a motor vehicle, if the motor vehicle becomes
exempt from the provisions of article 21 of the Tax Law, the permit may be
surrendered and the sticker destroyed, thus relieving the carrier thereof of
the necessity of including that vehicle in his tax returns. (See section
484.2
of
this Title.)

Example: A farmer has obtained a permit and sticker for a truck
which he operates to carry produce from farms not contiguous to his own. The
truck will no longer carry such produce but will be used exclusively for one of
the purposes set forth in section
471.5
of this

Title. The permit may be surrendered, and the sticker destroyed at the end of
the month in which he stops carrying produce from other farms. (c) A permit issued to the lessee of a motor
vehicle must be surrendered for cancellation and the sticker issued therefor
destroyed within five days after the termination of the lease. However, if a
permit and sticker are issued to a lessee of a motor vehicle, the permit and
sticker need not be surrendered at the termination of the lease if the lease is
immediately renewed or extended and the same lessee continues to operate the
motor vehicle. (d) A permit issued
to the owners of a motor vehicle must be surrendered for cancellation and the
sticker issued therefor destroyed within five days after a transfer when the
motor vehicle for which they were issued is transferred. (e) A permit issued for a motor vehicle must
be surrendered for cancellation and the sticker issued therefor destroyed
within five days after the motor vehicle is retired from service or junked, or
within five days after any transfer of the business which results in a change
of ownership of the motor vehicle. (See sections
473.4
and
474.5
of this Title.)
